applicant-name.name: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE OF AMERICA, INC

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SYSTEMS AND METHODS FOR INTEGRATED GLOBAL SHIPPING AND VISIBILITY

abstract.p: Disclosed is an integrated global shipment system that provides end-to-end visibility of the movement of a package. The integrated global shipment system employs a shipment consolidating application for integrating one or more freight tracking systems with one or more end-delivery systems. As a result, shippers are provided with complete visibility of the movement of their shipments of goods from an origin country to a destination country and till the final consignees. In addition, the integrated shipment system significantly decreases the cost of managing inventories by providing a virtual inventory solution. Under this virtual inventory solution, suppliers are able to bypass distribution centers and delay allocation of goods until after the importation of goods into a destination country.

applicant-name.name: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE OF AMERICA, INC

bibliographic-data.invention-title: INTEGRATED GLOBAL TRACKING AND VIRTUAL INVENTORY SYSTEM
SYSTEME DE SUIVI GLOBAL INTEGRE ET D'INVENTAIRE VIRTUEL

As a result, shippers are provided with complete visibility of the movement of their shipments of goods from an origin country to a destination country and till the final consignees. abstract.p: Disclosed is an integrated global shipment system that provides end-to-end visibility of the movement of a package. The integrated global shipment system employs a shipment consolidating application for integrating one or more freight tracking systems with one or more end-delivery systems. As a result, shippers are provided with complete visibility of the movement of their shipments of goods from an origin country to a destination country and till the final consignees. In addition, the integrated shipment system significantly decreases the cost of managing inventories by providing a virtual inventory solution. Under this virtual inventory solution, suppliers are able to bypass distribution centers and delay allocation of goods until after the importation of goods into a destination country.

applicant-name.name: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE OF AMERICA, INC

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Systems and methods for integrated global shipping and visibility

abstract.p: Disclosed is an integrated global shipment system that provides end-to-end visibility of the movement of a package. The integrated global shipment system employs a shipment consolidating application for integrating one or more freight tracking systems with one or more end-delivery systems. As a result, shippers are provided with complete visibility of the movement of their shipments of goods from an origin country to a destination country and till the final consignees. In addition, the integrated shipment system significantly decreases the cost of managing inventories by providing a virtual inventory solution. Under this virtual inventory solution, suppliers are able to bypass distribution centers and delay allocation of goods until after the importation of goods into a destination country.

The integrated global shipment system employs a shipment consolidating application for integrating one or more freight tracking systems with one or more end-delivery systems. As a result, shippers are provided with complete visibility of the movement of their shipments of goods from an origin country to a destination country and till the final consignees. In addition, the integrated shipment system significantly decreases the cost of managing inventories by providing a virtual inventory solution. Under this virtual inventory solution, suppliers are able to bypass distribution centers and delay allocation of goods until after the importation of goods into a destination country.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: INTEGRATED GLOBAL TRACKING AND VIRTUAL INVENTORY SYSTEM
SYSTEME DE SUIVI GLOBAL INTEGRE ET D'INVENTAIRE VIRTUEL

abstract.p: Disclosed is an integrated global shipment system that provides end-to-end visibility of the movement of a package. The integrated global shipment system employs a shipment consolidating application for integrating one or more freight tracking systems with one or more end-delivery systems. As a result, shippers are provided with complete visibility of the movement of their shipments of goods from an origin country to a destination country and till the final consignees. In addition, the integrated shipment system significantly decreases the cost of managing inventories by providing a virtual inventory solution. Under this virtual inventory solution, suppliers are able to bypass distribution centers and delay allocation of goods until after the importation of goods into a destination country.

L'invention concerne un système d'expédition global intégré offrant une visibilité de bout en bout du mouvement d'un colis. Ledit système d'expédition global intégré utilise une application de consolidation d'expédition pour intégrer un ou plusieurs système(s) de suivi de fret associé(s) à un ou plusieurs système(s) de distribution finale. En conséquence, les expéditeurs ont une visibilité totale du mouvement de leurs expéditions de marchandises d'un pays d'origine à un pays de destination et jusqu'aux destinataires finaux. En outre, ce système d'expédition global intégré réduit significativement le coût des inventaires de gestion par fourniture d'une solution d'inventaire virtuel.

Dans cette solution d'inventaire, les fournisseurs peuvent contourner les centres de distribution et retarder l'affectation de marchandises jusqu'à l'importation de marchandises dans un pays de destination.

applicant-name.name: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE OF AMERCIA, INC

bibliographic-data.invention-title: INTEGRATED GLOBAL TRACKING AND VIRTUAL INVENTORY SYSTEM
SYSTEME DE SUIVI GLOBAL INTEGRE ET D'INVENTAIRE VIRTUEL

In addition, the integrated shipment system significantly decreases the cost of managing inventories by providing a virtual inventory solution. Under this virtual inventory solution, suppliers are able to bypass distribution centers and delay allocation of goods until after the importation of goods into a destination country.
